semantic_title: Coding Abortion with Liveborn Fetus Outcomes
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Chapter 15: Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > q. Termination of Pregnancy and Spontaneous abortions > 1) Abortion with Liveborn Fetus

content.full_text: When an attempted termination of pregnancy results in a liveborn fetus, assign code Z33.2, Encounter for elective termination of pregnancy and a code from category Z37, Outcome of Delivery. (Evidence: pg no: 70, L42-L44)
content.summary: When attempted pregnancy termination results in live birth, use Z33.2 and appropriate Z37 code. (Evidence: pg no: 70, L42-L44)
key_concepts: Failed termination with live birth (Evidence: pg no: 70, L42-L43)
Dual coding requirement (Evidence: pg no: 70, L43-L44)
Outcome of delivery coding (Evidence: pg no: 70, L44)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign Z33.2 and Z37 code when termination results in liveborn fetus (Evidence: pg no: 70, L42-L44)
detailed_rules.explanation: When an attempted abortion fails and results in a live birth, both the termination encounter and the delivery outcome must be coded (Evidence: pg no: 70, L42-L44)

workflow_steps: Step 3: Assign Z33.2 for termination encounter
Step 4: Assign appropriate Z37 code for delivery outcome

code_ranges.description: Outcome of Delivery codes (Evidence: pg no: 70, L44)
code_ranges.requirement: Required when termination results in live birth
usage_rules: Use appropriate Z37 code based on delivery outcome (Evidence: pg no: 70, L44)

specific_codes.description: Encounter for elective termination of pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 70, L43-L44)
specific_codes.context: When attempted termination results in liveborn fetus

code_patterns.description: Standard pattern for failed termination with live birth (Evidence: pg no: 70, L43-L44)
code_patterns.example: Z33.2 with Z37.0 for single live birth
code_patterns.explanation: Captures both the termination attempt and the delivery outcome

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient undergoes elective termination procedure but delivers live infant
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient presented for elective termination at 22 weeks gestation. Procedure attempted but resulted in delivery of live infant.
step_by_step: Step 3: Code Z33.2 for termination encounter
Step 4: Code appropriate Z37 for delivery outcome

correct_coding.sequencing: Z33.2 and Z37.0 for single live birth
correct_coding.rationale: Both the termination attempt and live birth outcome must be documented (Evidence: pg no: 70, L42-L44)

incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Coding only the termination without the delivery outcome

warnings: Must code both termination encounter and delivery outcome (Evidence: pg no: 70, L43-L44)
best_practices: Use appropriate Z37 code based on specific delivery outcome
common_mistakes: Forgetting to code the delivery outcome when termination results in live birth
tips: Remember dual coding requirement for failed terminations with live births
implementation_notes: Captures both the intended procedure and actual outcome
clinical_context: Occurs in late-term termination attempts or procedure complications
